column1: starts with short of a length, rising towards the rib cage, played awkwardly towards fine leg. Was in the air but well away from the fielder
a hint of inward movement but ends up straying on the pads, the ball brushes the thigh pad and runs towards the fine boundary
fuller outside off, driven firmly but Lendl Simmons makes a diving stop to his left at mid-off
length ball but too straight, tucked away towards deep square leg
fuller outside off, pushed towards covers but Powell there
length ball but once again on middle and leg and swinging in, flicked towards fine leg
Was tucked away towards fine leg but a wayward throw and the two backing-up fielders fail to stop it. Results in an overthrow
fuller outside off, goes for the drive but gets an inside edge towards fine leg, Powell puts in the slide but he is in touch with the rope and the ball at the same time
length ball on middle but O'Brien has just picked it up over deep-backward square leg for a maximum
length ball around off, stays back and defends it on the off side
a dipping full toss on the pads, an appeal for lbw as O'Brien fails to get his bat on it, but the umpire reckons it was going down. They collect a leg bye to short fine leg
fuller around off, backs away a bit and launches it over covers for his first six of the innings
length ball outside off and O'Brien just steers it past point, pure timing there
muscles it through midwicket this time. Was a touch fuller, backs away and clobbers it, not from the middle but enough to take it to the boundary
Cottrell shortens his length but O'Brien clears his front leg and goes over cover this time, four more for Ireland
drilled down the ground, four fours in a row. Too full, too straight and smashed past the bowler
five in five, 116kph, a slower one from Cottrell. O'Brien throws everything at it but loses his shape in the process. However he's got enough on it to clear short third man
no, a length ball at the batsman. Tucked away in front of square leg as O'Brien is cramped on this occasion
length ball on the pads, flicked towards backward square leg
slower length ball around off, dabs it towards short third man where Cottrell fumbles but recovers in time to prevent an extra run. 50 comes up for Ireland
length ball angling in from middle, bowled wide of the crease as well. O'Brien looks to go leg side but misses and is hit on the body
fuller on the stumps, O'Brien looks to go over wide long-on but fails to middle it. Hetmyer moves to his right swiftly from long-on and takes it safely. Pollard once again strikes in his first over
a slower one outside off, was a touch early into the short but manages to get it over the cover fielder, Balbirnie was looking for a third but sent back
length ball around off, driven towards mid-off
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg for a quick two
length ball around off, driven firmly but straight towards extra cover
a touch wider this time, looks to chase but misses
slower one on the pads, glanced towards short fine leg

and the change of angle works. It's fuller on the stumps, Stirling misses the flick and given lbw. Unless it pitched outside leg it looks plumb. Stirling wants to review it. No bat involved and it pitched in line and would have gone on to hit the off stump. Stirling walks back, Ireland lose their review as well
slower one outside off, Delany watches it closely and lets it go through to the keeper
length ball outside off and coming in off the surface. He rolled his fingers over the ball. Balbirnie ends up playing inside the line of the ball
short of length outside off, Balbirnie backs away to create the width and cuts it past point for four
fuller on the pads and helped towards deep-backward square leg for a brace
length on middle and leg, flicked towards short midwicket
skips down this time but cannot beat extra cover
length outside off, width there but Balbirnie misses the cut
length outside off, and sliced precisely between backward point and short third man
good comeback. Almost a yorker at off and middle, squeezes it out towards deep point
a low full toss around off and whipped in front of square leg, great timing on that one
too full outside off, driven towards deep point
length ball on the pads, flicked towards deep square leg for one more
another attempted yorker ends up as low full toss, flicked towards midwicket
fuller on the pads from wide of the crease, flicked in front of square leg
length ball outside off, 108kph. Delany looked to push at it but got a thin edge and an easy catch for Pooran behind the stumps
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards square leg to get off the mark
short of length outside off, extra bounce there. Balbirnie dabs it down towards cover-point
and Pollard has got another one. A seam-up delivery this time, length ball outside off. Tector looks to drive at it and gets an outside edge to the keeper
length ball around off, looks to drop and run but it rolls parallel to the stumps. Pooran sprints to the ball to prevent the single
length ball outside off, cuts it towards deep point for one
banged in short but too much width there. Wilson hops and upper cuts it to the right of third man
fuller on the pads, flicked towards short midwicket where Walsh Jr fumbles and allows a single
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards long-on
slower one outside off, dips late. Steered towards third man
128kph, quicker one around off, Wilson stays back and chops it between backward point and short third man, using the pace of the bowler
length ball around off, stays back and drops it on the off side, Pollard fields himself
fuller around off, whips it back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, stays in his crease and opens the face of the bat for a single to short third man

length ball angling towards middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg and they are coming back for the second. A shy at the keeper's end as Pooran himself was running towards the ball. A direct hit and that was out, would have been close even if Bravo had collected the ball and broken the stumps
short of length around off, defended on the off side
fuller outside off, pushed towards long-on. Another excellent effort from Pollard with the ball. After picking up 4 for 25 in the last game, he finishes with 3 for 17 today
length ball outside off, worked towards backward point

improvisation goes wrong. Wilson goes down on one knee and looks to scoop over short fine leg, but it's a legnth ball outside off, Wilson changes his mind and tries to ramp it over only to lob it in the air. Simmons moves to his left from backward point and takes it easily

that's two in two for West Indies. Balbirnie steered this length ball towards backward point where Simmons threw himself to his left and deflected it towards third man. Balbirnie was turning for the second but Rutherford nails the direct hit from third man and Balbirnie was way short
pushed towards covers to get off the mark
a bouncer this time, Adair ducks under but this has been called a wide
short of length angling in to cramp the batsman. Ends up ramping towards backward point but short of the fielder
length outside off, goes for the cut but misses. A loud appeal for caught-behind but not out. Pollard ponders a review but decides against it int the end. Nothing on the UltraEdge
length ball around off, goes back and cuts it towards backward point
dropped short, goes back and cuts it towards deep extra cover. Shepherd puts in the slide at long-off but ends up fumbling. Recovers in time to stop it just inside
short of length outside off, goes back and mistimes it back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, looks to go over extra cover, ends up hitting straighter instead. One bounce to the incoming Romario from long-off
short of length around off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller on the stumps, a big bat lift but no timing. The ball rolls towards long-on
length ball around off, finds the backward point with cut
fuller around off, mistimes it towards the left of the bowler, they sneak in a single
fuller and wider, looks to chase but misses
a wide full toss outside off, the batsman cannot reach there
a slower length ball outside off, skips down and cuts it towards deep point
fuller outside off, drives it towards long-off for one
fuller again, pushed towards mid-off. Lewis charges in to keep it to one

length ball on the pads, flicked towards short fine leg. Cottrell with a shy at the stumps and he nails it. Adair was dragging his bat, but no one is interested. However, replays show Adair was just short. Pollard is now checking with the umpire and he wants to review it. Looked like it was Bravo who prompted his captain. Adair is not happy. He was short of his ground but did West Indies review in time? Or was the initial appeal in time? I am not sure what playing condition applies here
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
short of length around off, surprises the batsman with extra bounce. Simi Singh ends up fending at it and offers an easy catch to Bravo at short third man
fuller on the pads, flicked towards fine leg. The initial call was for two but Lewis was quick to the ball
slower one outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover for a couple
fuller on the leg stump, pushed towards mid-on
fuller around off, pushes it towards covers
slower one outside off, pushes it into the covers for another quick single
length outside off, steers it behind point for one more
a bouncer on the leg stump, Young just manages to duck under it
fuller outside off, drives it towards covers but straight to the fielder
128kph, length ball outside off, looks to smash it on the leg side but is early into the shot. No connection
slower length ball outside off, turned in front of square leg
slower again, steered towards backward point
a brilliant yorker, Young jams his bat at it
slower length ball on middle and leg. Flicked towards short fine leg
cutter again, length ball around off and middle, stays back and pulls it towards deep midwicket
fuller outside off, opens the face of the bat to run it through the gap between point and short third man
fuller on the pads, flicked towards deep square leg
length ball around off, defends it towards the vacant short midwicket area for a single
a dipping full toss at the stumps, turned towards square leg
slower one comes in handy for Bravo for the nth time. Was fuller around off, Young was fooled into playing early and ends up just spooning it to Simmons at backward point
goes for the yorker, dipping on middle and leg, defends it on the leg side
short of length outside off, ramps it towards third man
length ball on middle and leg, beats the batsman but it goes just over the stumps
slower one around off, Little had to adjust and defend
length ball on the pads, flicked towards fine leg
fuller around off, struck firmly past the bowler but only a single
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
picks up the slower one this time and dispatches it over the deep midwicket boundary
length ball around off, goes for the pull but misses
length ball outside off, hangs his bat out but gets beaten
length ball at the batsman, backs away and pulls it firmly towards the right of long-on, Walsh Jr is quick across the ground and throws in the same motion to keep it to one
slower length ball around off, mistimes the pull towards long-on
fuller outside off, steered towards for a quick single
A wide yorker and McCarthy fails to get bat on it
slower length ball on middle and leg, Little was early into the shot as he looks to pull it away. Ends up getting the top edge and Pooran makes no mistake
length ball around off, defended from the crease
length around off again, pushed towards point
a touch fuller around off, opens the face to work it towards short third man
length ball around off, defended again
fuller around off, pushes it towards covers to get off the mark
grip and turn for Stirling. Length ball around off, Lewis was looking to defend but it spins away from him
length ball around off, punched towards extra cover
length ball around off, goes back and smashes it over deep midwicket, clearing the boundary comfortably, wind also helping him there
fuller around off and he scythes it through covers for four more
length outside off and steered behind point this time, just opening the face of the bat
slower length ball, punched towards mid-off from the back foot
slower again, on middle and leg, turns it towards square leg
length ball at the stumps, goes back and punches it towards long-on
slower in the air, length ball around off. Lewis looks to go for the slog sweep but mistimes. Two to deep midwicket
length ball around off, keeps coming in with the arm. A tentative push
length ball outside off, goes for the cut but Adair makes a good stop at cover
once again goes for the slog sweep but ends up top-edging it towards deep midwicket, McCarthy runs backwards and pushes it just inside the boundary line
a touch short this time, Lewis rocks back and smashes it over deep square leg
fuller and wider outside off and caressed between cover and point
slower bouncer, Simmons was looking to pull it away but checks his shot in the end
length ball outside off, goes back and pulls it towards deep midwicket
slower one around off, stays in his crease and blocks
length ball at the stumps, backs away and pulls, mistimes it towards long-on
length but down the leg side, shout for not out but Ireland escape with the wide. Or may it just brushed the trousers
fuller outside off, Lewis moves towards the off side and looks to hit it over long-on, mistimes it over cover
length ball around off, backs away and slaps it towards mid-off
length ball outside off, cuts it firmly but there is a deep point in place
dropped. A slower one. Fuller around off, Simmons looks to go over long-off but mistimes it. Balbirnie pedals back from mid-off, settles under but it slips through
fuller on the pads, misses the flick and is rapped on the pads

short of length around off, Lewis goes for the pull, gets a top edge over mid-off, Balbirnie runs back but cannot reach to the ball and it dribbles towards the boundary. The momentum has taken him over the boundary line and when he flicks the ball back, his foot was still grounded outside the boundary line. Not a difficult one for third umpire
length ball and this has been dispatched over long-on, stars the over with a six
short of length outside off, backs away a bit to create some room and cuts it over extra cover, sails over the boundary line
length around off, slaps it to the right of mid-off where Balbirnie makes a one-handed diving stop
length ball around off, goes for the cut but it's too close. A healthy edge through the vacant slip area for four more
a slower bouncer, goes for the pull but Simmons was too early into the shot. Misses
fuller around off, steers it towards cover-point. Stirling there
fuller on the stumps from around the wicket and Lewis sweeps it fine, to the right of short fine leg
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards sweeper cover
fuller this time, spinning in a bit, Simmons goes leg side and launches it over wide long-on
pitched up again, mistimes the slog sweep to deep midwicket
length outside off, cuts square of the wicket
fuller around off, pushed back towards the bowler
a slower one outside off and Lewis has given it his all. Muscles it over long-off for a six
fuller around off, driven towards long-off
length ball at the stumps, goes back and smashes it in front of square leg, gets to his fifty in just 28 balls
fuller on middle and leg, whipped towards long-on
goes for the short one from around the wicket but too high. Lewis doesn't bother playing at it
length ball angling away, misses the cut
length ball but this time within Lewis' reach. Smashes to the right of mid-off
skips down but it's short of length delivery, wide outside off. Forehands it back towards the bowler
in the blockhole this time, jams his bat at it
length ball and it sits up nicely for Simmons who opens up and pulls it over deep midwicket, his sixth six of the innings
fuller and absolutely smashed towards long-off, only a single though
fuller and wider, hits it towards sweeper cover
length ball, Simmons charges down, takes it from outside off and dispatches it over long-on. Brings up the team's 100 with that hit
fuller around off, steered towards sweeper cover
a full toss outside off, clobbers it wide of long-on but it hits the bottom of the bat. Scampers back for the second
fuller around off, looks to go towards wide long-on, mistimes it towards square leg
fuller and wider outside off, Simmons leaves it alone, a tight call of wide
walks towards the bowler to cut down the angle. Reaches to the pitch of the ball and smashes it over long-on for his eighth six of the night
fuller and wider outside off, smashes it over extra cover, long-off cannot come across in time
but no respite for McCarthy. Banged in short, Simmons goes back and smashes it over deep midwicket. Simmons moves to 85
length ball around off, punched towards extra cover
slower in the air but Lewis just hits it through the line, keeps his head down, he knows it's heading only in one direction
short of length, rocks back and smashes it past the non-striker, moves to 46 with that four
tossed up outside off, looks to slog sweep it and finish the game but gets a top edge and Wilson settles under it. Too late for Ireland though
length ball at the stumps, goes back and punches it towards deep extra cover
a juicy full toss and Simmons needs no second invitation. Disposes it over deep midwicket for his tenth six
